form.official-title: To amend the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to allow certain activities to be carried out with regard to certain fish held in captivity or a controlled environment.

section.header: Fish held in captivity or controlled environment
section.text: Section 9(b) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1538(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Fish held in captivity or controlled environment

subparagraph.text: The provisions of subsection (a)(1) and section 7(a)(2) do not apply toâ€”

clause.text: a fish legally held in captivity or in a controlled environment in a manner that maintains physical separation of such fish from any wild population of the same species on the date of the enactment of this paragraph; or
progeny of a fish described in clause (i) legally held in the manner described in clause (i),

subparagraph.continuation-text: until such time as any such fish or progeny is intentionally released from such captivity or controlled environment to live in the wild.

clause.text: A person that holds a fish or progeny described in subparagraph (A) shall be able to demonstrate to the Secretary that such fish or progeny qualifies as a fish or progeny described in subparagraph (A).

A person that holds a fish or progeny described in subparagraph (A) may fulfill the demonstration requirement described in clause (i) through compliance with the applicable provisions of the Convention.
